In the Swamp by RACHEL SUMMER TUPELO
Once upon a time in the swamps of Mystoesia I pulled out my folding chair and watched a portly broken bottle -- no label, clearly astute -- have an argument with a passing brown hop-toad. They began by skirmishing over right-of-way logistics but five minutes in they were screaming, neck veins bulging, about swamp dialects, country music, the weight of cloud formations, pinochle moves, basic chemistry, you name it. For awhile the air was heated and burnt smelling the way it is when I spend too long in the toaster, but after a bit things cooled off as they turned to discussing water-saving shower-head devices, a topic on which there was much common ground to be shared. It seemed like they'd both needed the fight, and felt the better for it, but it left me feeling anxious and jaded. I walked slowly down towards the edge of the swamp and sat on a stump of a long-decayed cedar.
"If only I had an accordion," I thought.

has 458 rooms. we have a combination of suites, king and double rooms. As the innovation hub of Hilton Worldwide, we also feature many concept rooms. Please ask our front desk if you are interested in learning more
guests have kept me busy so I haven't had a chance to look outside. I suggest asking the front desk for a weather report if you're truly interested.
provides standard TV cable entertainment for all its guests. On demand options are also available
front desk can provide you more information about our Hilton h honors program or you can look online at h honors dot hilton dot com for more details
fitness center is located on the ground floor and open 24-hours a day with key card access
has 30,000 square feet of flexible, accessible meeting space, containing 2 ballrooms, an Atrium, and 21 break-out rooms.
pool is on the ground floor and open Monday through Friday, 5PM-9PM. There is always a lifeguard on duty. It is 25 feet in length, 3 feet deep, with accessible wheelchair entry.
offers free local calling from your hotel room phone
offers beautifully appointed Executive Level Rooms, the ultimate guest experience. Please see the front desk for more details
offers wake up calls services. Please call the front desk to schedule your call
front desk can tell you all about the various Washington DC attractions or sports teams, give you directions or a map, or help you set up a tour
has 4 beehives on the roof and harvests over 200 pounds of honey. The honey can be purchased in our gift shop
offers complimentary coffee and tea in each room. Drinks are also available for purchase in the pantry, located near the front desk
is one of many hotels that is a part of the Hilton Hotels chain, founded by Conrad Nicholson Hilton, who was born Christmas Day eighteen eighty seven and passed away on January 3, 1979
is an amazing hotel with 458 rooms, but the Hilton Hawaiian Village is the largest Hilton hotel with over 3,300 rooms
does not offer snacks in the hotel room. Snacks are available for purchase in the gift shop, located in the lobby
is happy to provide you with extra items such as pillows or towels as needed. Please see the front desk for more assistance
does not allow pets but is happy to host service canines for those in need
hired me as a conceirge in early 2016 and I absolutely love it here! I love interacting with hotel guests
is located about 2.5 miles from the nearest Tennis Court, the Hamlet Swim and Tennis Club

is a non-smoking facility, however, you are able to smoke cigarettes outside the front and south entrances of the hotel. The hotel does not sell cigarettes, but there is a grocery store less than a mile away where you can purchase them. The hotel does sell cigars which can be smoked on harth's patio.

restrooms are located both at the front of the hotel and at the back. At the front of the hotel, the restrooms are located next to our Tech Lounge. At the back of the hotel, the restrooms are located in the hallway leading to the ballrooms.

Harth restaurant is open for breakfast Monday through Friday 6:30am to 11AM, and Saturday and Sunday, 7AM to 1PM. The restaurant is open for lunch Monday through Friday 11:30AM to 2PM, and is open for dinner Monday through Saturday 5PM to 10PM and is closed for dinner on Sundays.
has a 24-hour pantry located next to the front desk where you can find sandwiches, drinks, an assortment of medications, toiletries and other necessities.
has a metro station in Tysons Corner, located just half a mile from the hotel, and about a 15 minutes walk. However, we only offer shuttle service to the McLean metro station located closer to DC.
front desk can assist you with setting up catering services for your upcoming event.
accepts most major credit cards such as Visa, Master Card, American Express, and Discover. For a full list of accepted credit cards please see the front desk
has local shopping options in Tysons Corner Center & Tysons Galleria about 1 mile away and within walking distance. However, we recommend taking our complimentary shuttle for easy travel.
is located about 3 miles away from the McLean Hamlet Park. Please see the front desk for directions
has computers available to you if you wish to book a flight. I am not a travel agent so I cannot do it for you

has two parking lots where you are free to park in any available space. One is located in the front of the hotel, and a larger one is located in the back of the hotel. We have close to 1000 spaces available for your use.

has an emergency response team 24 hours a day. In the event of an emergency, calling the hotel internal emergency number, which is 66, will initiate the appropriate response. Emergency evacuation routes and procedures are located on the inside of all guestroom doors
swimming pool prohibits skinny dipping. If you need to buy a swim suit, our complimentary shuttles can take you to the Tysons Corner mall
Harth restaurant and lounge features seasonal menus that accommodate all dietary needs including gluten-free and vegetarian. Please ask the host to take a look at our latest culinary creations.

has wi-fi throughout the hotel, and is complimentary to all guest in the lobby. We also feature complimentary in-room wi-fi to our Hilton h honors members. Simply connect to the network labeled "attwifi" in the lobby and enter your name & room number, or if you are h honors members, connect to the network labeled "h honors."

You can use the hotel's elevators to reach the Lower Level, Upper Level and the guest room floors. Our elevators face the South Entrance of the hotel and are located behind Harth Bar

Harth restaurant is open for breakfast Monday through Friday 6:30am to 11AM, and Saturday and Sunday, 7AM to 1PM. The restaurant is open for lunch Monday through Friday 11:30AM to 2PM, and is open for dinner Monday through Saturday 5PM to 10PM and is closed for dinner on Sundays
Hotel Security can be reached by contacting the front desk or dialing the hotel internal emergency number which is 66
The front desk can assist you in checking in or if you are checking out
You can make reservations and inquiries about Magiano's by calling the restaurant at (703) 356-9000

We have a 24-hour fitness center with key card access located on our ground floor. There are also many trails around the hotel. Please see our front desk team members for a map and more information about exercising outside.
Executive Level Rooms are available at the Hilton McLean and they include many benefits such as luxury bath amentities, please see the front desk for more information

You can find a range of business services in our Tech Lounge, including email, fax and photocopy facilities. The Tech Lounge is located in the hotel's main lobby. For assistance with a particular function, please speak to a front desk team member
Please visit our front desk for assistance with anything you need during your stay. They are always happy to help
The Hilton McLean has 4 beehives on the roof and harvests over 200 pounds of honey a year. The honey can be purchased in our gift shop
To find basic amenities, including snacks, drinks and medication, please visit the hotel gift shop. The gift shop is located in the hotel lobby and is open 24 hours a day
The front desk can probably give you a better opinion on the matter
To get gas, oil changes and other automotive services, please visit the nearest gas station. It is located at the corner of International Drive and Chain Bridge Road, about one mile from the hotel
The Hilton McLean does not allow pets but is happy to host service canines for those in need

To gain access to the Silver Line and the Washington Metro system, you can go to the Tyson's Corner metro station, which is located about a mile and a 15 minutes walk from the hotel. However, we only offer shuttle service to the McLean metro station located closer to DC
The Hilton McLean hotel guests have kept me busy today so I haven't had a chance to check out a weather forecast. The front desk can give you a weather report if you are truly interested
For a broad range of shopping and dining options, please visit the Tyson's Corner Center and Tyson's Galleria. Our complimentary shuttle can take you to both malls
The closest tennis courts are at the Hamlet Swim and Tennis Club located about 2.5 miles away from the hotel

In order to park your car, please find complementary parking to the front and rear of the hotel. The rear parking lot is home to more spaces, so drivers with larger vehicles may find parking easier in the rear of the hotel. We have close to 1000 spaces available for your use

We have wi-fi throughout the hotel, and is complimentary to all guest in the lobby. We also feature complimentary in-room wi-fi to our Hilton h honors members. Simply connect to the network labeled attwifi in the lobby and enter your name & room number, or if you are h honors members, connect to the network labeled h honors

Complimentary shuttle rides can be reserved through the Front Desk. Pick-up locations include the front of Hilton McLean, the lower level of Neiman Marcus at Tysons Galleria, in front of Coastal Flats at Tysons Corner Center and the kiss and ride across from the McLean metro stop
To redeem your complimentary breakfast voucher, please visit Harth Restaurant between 6:30AM and 10AM and speak to the hostess

To make a reservation for any of the hotel's meeting rooms, please speak to a front desk team member. Alternatively, you can call the hotel at (703) 847-5000 and ask for reservations. With 30,000 square feet of flexible meeting space, an award winning sales, catering and service team, and all of the latest meeting room technologies, Hilton McLean is your perfect meeting place!

In case of an emergency, the Hilton McLean has an emergency response team 24 hours a day. In the event of an emergency, calling the hotel internal emergency number, which is 66, will initiate the appropriate response. Emergency evacuation routes and procedures are located on the inside of all guestroom doors

We keep taxi cabs at the ready for your use in the front of the hotel. Simply proceed there and our bell staff can help you. If you'd like to arrange a cab for a later time, please see a front desk team member and they will be able to arrange that for you

To charge your phone, please use your charger at any of our charging points. These are located around the hotel lobby for your convenience. Should you need further assistance, please speak to a front desk team member

To arrange a private function at Harth Lounge, please speak to a front desk team member. Alternatively, you can call the hotel at (703) 847-5000 and ask to be connected to Harth Lounge in order to plan your event

To reserve event space for the Fowler Room, or for any of the hotel's other meeting spaces, please speak to a front desk team member. Alternatively, you can call the hotel at (703) 847-5000 to make a reservation
The Washington DC cherry Blossoms are typically in bloom the end of March or beginning of April. They are absolutely beautiful
The Hilton McLean is happy to provide you with extra items, such as pillows or towels, as needed. Please see the front desk for more assistance

Welcome to the Hilton McLean. I am Connie the robotic concierge. I am here to answer your questions about the hotel and give you recommendations about the Washington DC area. I hope you have a delightful experience
I absolutely love being a concierge here at the Hilton McLean, the guests here are amazing! It is the best job ever
The Hilton McLean hired me as a concierge in early 2016 and I absolutely love it here. I love interacting with hotel guests
Conrad Nicholson Hilton, born Christmas Day eighteen eighty seven and passed away on January 3, 1979, was a hotelier and the founder of the Hilton Hotels chain
You can access the front entrance through the automatic doors at the front of the hotel building, just off the main lobby
For a full list of all Hilton Hotels and their locations please see the front desk or go online to the hilton website
Firearms are strictly prohibited in the hotel. Pyrotechnics and fog machines are also banned
The name of this hotel is the Hilton McLean Tysons Corner
The Hilton Worldwide headquarters is located next to the Hilton McLean hotel

If you would like to purchase in-room Wi-Fi, please follow the directions on the splash page that appears when you first open your browser while in-room
You can request my help anytime

Our complimentary shuttle can be reserved by talking to the Front Desk. It goes to Tysons Galleria, Tysons Corner Center, the McLean metro stop, and anywhere within a 1-mile radius. The shuttle runs on weekdays from 7:30AM to about 10:40PM and on weekends from 8:30AM to about 10:40PM
Seating at the Harth Lounge cannot be reserved. Come on over there is plenty of space for everybody
I cannot help you with flight information or booking tickets. Good luck!

"; var table3ColTemplateGraph2 = "
ROWS{}

"; %>

Dialog Report for [ORG_NAME]'s [VA_NAME]
Period - From: <% PRINT(dateFrom); %>     To: <% PRINT(dateTo); %>

Engagement
<% var chatVolumeSet = VALUE_SET("Conversation Volume", "#", "Measurement", numChats, "1", "Total Conversations"); PRINT_TEMPLATE(chatVolumeSet, tableSetTemplate1); var timeChatsSet = VALUE_SET( "Conversation Data: Time", "#", "Measurement", CHATSTATS_TIME_AVG(), "1", "Avg minutes", CHATSTATS_TIME_MIN(), "1", "Min minutes", CHATSTATS_TIME_MAX(), "1", "Max minutes", CHATSTATS_TIME_MEDIAN(), "1", "Median minutes", CHATSTATS_TIME_TOTAL(), "1", "Total minutes"); PRINT_TEMPLATE(timeChatsSet, tableSetTemplate1); PRINT_TEMPLATE(CHATSTATS_TIME_SPREAD("","%","Measurement"), "", "300", "300", tableSetGraphTemplate3); var msgChatsSet = VALUE_SET( "Conversation Data: Messages", "#", "Measurement", CHATSTATS_MSG_AVG(), "1", "Avg messages", CHATSTATS_MSG_MIN(), "1", "Min messages", CHATSTATS_MSG_MAX(), "1", "Max messages", CHATSTATS_MSG_MEDIAN(), "1", "Median messages", CHATSTATS_MSG_TOTAL(), "1", "Total messages"); PRINT_TEMPLATE(msgChatsSet, tableSetTemplate1); PRINT_TEMPLATE(CHATSTATS_MSG_SPREAD("","%","Measurement"), tableSetTemplate3); PRINT_TEMPLATE(CHATSTATS_LOCATION_SPREAD("Location","%","Measurement"), tableSetTemplate3); %>
Performance
Overall Accuracy<%PRINT_NUMBER(ACCURACY_RATE(),"##.#%");%>
Direct Match Rate<%PRINT_NUMBER(DIRECT_MATCH_RATE(),"##.#%");%>
Direct Default Rate<%PRINT_NUMBER(DIRECT_DEFAULT_RATE(),"##.#%");%>
AutoLearn Rate<%PRINT_NUMBER(AUTOLEARN_RATE(),"##.#%");%>
AutoLearn Match Rate<%PRINT_NUMBER(AUTOLEARN_MATCH_RATE(),"##.#%");%>
AutoLearn Default Rate<%PRINT_NUMBER(AUTOLEARN_DEFAULT_RATE(),"##.#%");%>
Learning About Users
<% var foldersSet = HIT_COUNT_TOP("FOLDER", topHitsNodeIdScope, numTopHits, "Most Popular Topics of Interest", "#", "Topic"); PRINT_TEMPLATE(foldersSet, tableSetTemplate2); var questionSet = HIT_COUNT_TOP("INPUT", topHitsNodeIdScope, numTopHits, "Most Frequently Asked Questions", "#", "Question"); PRINT_TEMPLATE(questionSet, tableSetTemplate2); %> <% PRINT_TEMPLATE(HITNODE_RULE_SETS(), table3ColTemplate1); PRINT_TEMPLATE(PROFILEVALUE_RULE_SETS(), table3ColTemplate1); %>
